plugins.name: Android / iOS Converter
plugins.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è To use the plugin, you must be on a team with a Professional plan to have access to shared component libraries.


üëâ Installation


Step 1

To use the plugin, you have to enter your Access Token. You can revoke access at any time.

  1. Login to your Figma account.
  2. Head to the "account settings" from the top-left a Figma menu.
  3. Find the personal access tokens section.
  4. Click "Create new token"
  5. A token will be generated. This will be your only chance to copy the token, so make sure you keep a copy of this in a secure place.


Step 2

Enter link to your Team ID, eg https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234

  1. Open your Figma account and click on the "Teams" tab in the left sidebar.
  2. Right-click on the team you want to add
  3. Click "Copy link"
  4. Link will be copied to clipboard


üëâ Component replacement rule settings


To use the plugin, you must be on a team with a Professional plan to have access to shared component libraries.

Go to figma.com, open your team profile through the menu on the left by clicking on the team name highlighted in bold.

Copy the team ID from the address bar into the field below: https://www.figma.com/files/team/[team ID]/[team name]

Example: Button = Button


üëâ Text replacement rule settings

You can set up text style replacement rules synchronization for your Figma team

by creating a regular fig file called ‚ÄúANDROID_IOS_CONVERTER_TEXT_RULES‚Äù inside any team project and give read access to all members.

Create a text element and write down the rules as pictured inside the file.

Enter the name of the text style from the Android library and its counterpart from the iOS library through ‚Äú=‚Äù.

Android on the left, iOS on the right. After that, the rules will automatically be synchronized every time you open Android / iOS Converter.
plugins.tagline: Fast and easy convert layouts, texts and components from Android to iOS and back

plugins.name: Automater
plugins.description:
A bunch of commands collected into a plugin.


Features

  1. add interactions in series: connects all frames in sequence by position (Z flow)
  2. add autolayout to each layer: works best with groups or frames
  3. align multiple layers at once
  4. adjust image sizing of multiple layers
  5. add constraints to the "Quick actions..." menu
  6. object related actions, like: bulk group, frame, flatten, boolean, flip or reset flip
  7. select layers, including previous and next siblings: works with multiple layers
  8. basic transform for text characters


Recent major changes

  1. The paste commands have been upgraded and are now available in a dedicated plugin called Paster.
  2. Resize selection has also been enhanced and is not part of a dedicated plugin called Resizer.
  3. Set constraints have been removed. Recommend Quick Constraints by Gleb instead.


Known issues

  1. "Transform text > Title case" is not an actual proper title case.


Keyboard shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control-Comma (,): Select previous siblings
  2. Control-Period (.): Select next siblings

plugins.name: Text Edit
plugins.description:
Edit all of your text in one place.

To use Text Edit, run the plugin on a page that you'd like to edit. Text Edit will show you an alphabetically sorted list of all text layers on your current page. You can now edit all of the text directly from the plugin.

Text layers that have the same content will be merged into a single item in the list.

If you make changes on the canvas while the plugin is running, press the "Resync changes made on the canvas" button to update the list to reflect your updates.

plugins.name: Select all instances
plugins.description:
A plugin for component instance inspection and selection.


Better manage the use of any component library, find missing main components, fine tune your selections for editing (eg: avoid nested instances), make large selections and act on it (Select > Detach).


Features

  • Flexible instance selection: adjust the filters > select all instances.
  • Inspect main component info for each instance: local/remote, existing/missing.
  • Search by term: exact match with `"term"` or `"term`).
  • Search in current selection to find children instances for any node type: sections, frames, etc.
  • Filter out nested instances: allows working only with instances inside main. components, so that nested ones can inherit the changes without overrides.
  • Filter visible/hidden instances.
  • Filter up-to-date/outdated instances.
  • Filter local/remote components.
  • Filter missing/existing components.


üôè If you find this plugin useful please consider sponsoring my work: https://github.com/sponsors/morekid


Fancy a feature? Add a request.


GitHub
plugins.tagline: Swiss army knife for component instance inspection and selection.

plugins.name: EyeQuant Inspect
plugins.description:
Is the button visible enough? Is my design too cluttered? Is the content in the right place?


Instantly see how users will respond to your designs - as early as a high fidelity wireframe or prototype - so you know what works and what doesn‚Äôt, before you go live. 


EyeQuant is an essential product for designers to create more successful digital experiences and maximise design performance. 


Features 


  1. Attention Heatmaps 
  2. Clarity scores 
  3. Excitingness scores 
  4. Regions of Interest 


How does the EyeQuant plugin work?


  1. Select the Figma frame you want to analyse
  2. Go to Plugins > EyeQuant Inspect > Analyse 
  3. View the results


If you don‚Äôt have an EyeQuant account, you can try for free.


The Tech 


EyeQuant‚Äôs technology fuses AI and neuroscience to simulate a 200-person study in seconds, giving you instant, actionable results. 


It is the result of more than a decade of institutional academic research by leading neuro and data scientists at CalTech and the University of Osnabr√ºck.


See more here ‚Äî> https://www.eyequant.com/how/


Want to help improve this plugin? Send us your feedback ‚Üí support@eyequant.com
plugins.tagline: Data driven design

plugins.name: Sort on Canvas by Name
plugins.description:
Changes positions of frames, components or other objects on canvas by name. Unlike other plugins that only order frames or other layers by name in the layers panel, this plugin can organize them by name on the canvas. However, the plugin will also arrange layers by name if they all belong to one parent element.


How to use

  1. Select layers you want to sort. Preferably they should belong to one parent but anything will work. Run the plugin, it will sort your layers.
  2. You can also select nothing, in this case plugin will automatically find all frames (only frames) on the page and sort them.


If something is broken or you have feedback, feel free to reach out via support contact on the right side of this page.
plugins.tagline: Changes positions of objects on canvas and in layers panel by name

Textsmith is the ultimate text reshaping tool that lets you easily manipulate, transform, distort, and warp text for creative and professional designs. With its redesigned drag-and-drop interface, new advanced tools, and built-in shortcut key support, it‚Äôs perfect for typography design, logos, posters, and more.


üöÄ What it does:

Textsmith simplifies text manipulation by allowing users to reshape text directly. Whether you need to bend, morph, or customize fonts, this tool makes it effortless. With access to a huge library of Google Fonts, customizable fill colors, and stroke colors, you can create unique typography distortion effects in seconds. Advanced features like zooming, panning, background grids, snap-to-grid, undo/redo, and shortcut key support give you precise control over your designs.


Once your design is ready, it is automatically exported as an SVG path, where you can take advantage of Figma‚Äôs built-in SVG path editing capabilities for additional fine-tuning.


‚öôÔ∏è Key Features:

  1. Reshape text with drag-and-drop control points.
  2. Access a vast library of Google Fonts for endless design options.
  3. Apply text warping and bending for creative typography.
  4. Use control mirroring to mirror control point positions horizontally or vertically.
  5. Customize fill colors and stroke colors to enhance your designs.
  6. Seamlessly integrate with Figma for advanced path editing.
  7. NEW: Enable or disable background grids for precise alignment.
  8. NEW: Snap to the grid for perfect positioning or turn it off for freeform creativity.
  9. NEW: Undo and redo functionality for quick corrections.
  10. NEW: Zoom and pan controls for better navigation and close-up editing.
  11. NEW: Shortcut key support for all new features, making your workflow faster and more efficient.


üìù Instructions: Using Textsmith is quick and easy:

  1. Input the text you want to reshape.
  2. Select a font from our extensive library of Google Fonts.
  3. Drag control points to distort, transform, or warp the text as needed.
  4. [Optional] Use control mirroring to achieve symmetrical designs by mirroring control points horizontally or vertically.
  5. [Optional] Pick a fill color and a stroke color to further customize your text.
  6. Use zoom and pan controls to focus on specific areas of your design.
  7. Use undo and redo to make quick corrections.
  8. Once you‚Äôre done, your reshaped text is automatically added to Figma as an SVG path, ready for fine-tuning using Figma‚Äôs path editing tools.


Textsmith is the ultimate typography tool for designers looking to reshape, warp, or transform text into creative and professional designs. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a seasoned designer, Textsmith makes it easy to create stunning text distortion effects for any project.


Start reshaping text today with Textsmith ‚Äì the easiest way to manipulate text, bend fonts, and add unique typography effects to your designs.
plugins.tagline: Reshape, Warp, Manipulate and Transform Text with SVG Path Export

plugins.name: Style Sync
plugins.description:
Style Sync give you the ability to apply styles (color & text) to all elements with matching properties in your design files.


Requirements

  • Elements must be visible
  • Colors fills must be visible


Notes

  • Color Style: support solid fills property & opacity
  • Text Style: support (Font-Family, Font-Style, Font-Size, Line-Height, Letter-Spacing, Text-Decoration, Case)
  • Stroke Style: WIP


Know issue

  • Text Style: *Imported fonts dosent sync properly


Plugin Synergy

Pair well with Find and Replace, a plugin that give you the ability to to find all instance of a specific color and replace it by another one in your entire project files


You can support by

plugins.name: Scale Better
plugins.description:
Scale by percent or exact width/height without the annoying decimal characters. This plugin makes the process of scaling super easy.


With Scale Better you can scale any number of items in your current selection by percentage, width or height. You can even scale up and down to the largest or smallest item in your selection.


With the scale factor option, round your scaling to the closest value based on your grid (for example, set scale factor to 8 to ensure your scaled elements are always divisible by 8).


You can also leverage the scale origin control for easy scaling orientation.

accepted.name: Karl Koch
accepted.description: Currently building DuckDuckGo, Cosmic, Hand‚Ä∫‚Ä∫over, and plugins.run.

plugins.tagline: Scale by percent or exact width/height without the annoying decimal characters.

plugins.name: Fast Generate Color Styles
plugins.description:
With just one click, Fast Generate Color Style enables you to swiftly generate a comprehensive base color style, saving you valuable time and effort.


How it works

  1. Click an object with Fill property
  2. Run plugin
  3. Plugin will create 9 shades of color and add all of these colors to your style


Why use Fast Generate Color Style ?

  • One click generate, saving your time for choosing foundation color style
  • Ideal for beginners who are confused when choosing colors for their design


You can found code for plugin here

https://github.com/loitran1995/FigmaPlugin/


Contact

If you have any questions, suggestions, or concerns regarding this repository, please don't hesitate to contact us at work.frog2005@gmail.com.

Happy designing!
plugins.tagline: Plugin help you fast generate simple color style

plugins.name: Keyboard Scrolling
plugins.description:
Scroll around a Figma document using your keyboard arrow keys.


While zooming in and out of a Figma page is possible via a mouse / trackpad or keyboard shortcuts, the ability to scroll and pan around a Figma page is currently constrained to mouse / trackpad interactions and therefore somewhat inaccessible to users who don't use a mouse / trackpad input.


*This plugin is primarily meant for designers using voice recognition solutions who aren't able to scroll easily otherwise

plugins.name: Get Palette
plugins.description:
Get Palette helps you to create beautiful colour palettes using images.


Colours are extracted from your image using the K-means method. You can simply select an image and run the plugin. Furthermore, you can choose the number of colours you want the plugin to extract (default number = 5). The range varies from 1 to 10. So, you can better customize the output.

plugins.name: CSS Extractor
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor - Figma To CSS

Introducing the CSS Extractor, a powerful Figma plugin that simplifies the process of extracting CSS styles from your design elements.

Transform your Figma design workflow with the Figma CSS Extractor Plugin, a powerful tool that simplifies the process of extracting CSS styles from Figma elements.


Buy Me A Coffee

https://www.buymeacoffee.com/usamarajpoot

Portfolio:

https://usamarajpoot.vercel.app/

Github

https://github.com/usamarajpoot403/


Key Features:

  • Effortless Extraction: Instantly extract CSS styles from any Figma element.
  • Clean Code Output: Generate well-organized and readable CSS code.
  • Time-Saving: Streamline your design-to-code process for web development.


How It Works:

  • 1. Select any element in your Figma design.
  • 2. Run the plugin to automatically extract its CSS styles.
  • 3. Copy and paste the generated CSS code into your project.


Benefits:

  • Seamless Integration: Integrate extracted styles directly into your web development projects.
  • Consistency: Ensure design-to-code consistency with accurate CSS representation.
  • Enhanced Collaboration: Facilitate collaboration between designers and developers.


Technical Details:

  • Technology: Developed using HTML, CSS, JS and Figma Api.
  • Compatibility: Compatible with the latest versions of Figma.


Results:

Experience a smoother design handoff process and accelerate your web development workflow with the Figma CSS Extractor Plugin.


Stay tuned for updates!
plugins.tagline: Figma To CSS

plugins.name: Fontiger
plugins.description:
Round fractional font sizes to their nearest integer value. For example, text with font size 9.1px will be rounded (down) to 9px, and 9.6px will be rounded (up) to 10px.


The plugin works on 'Frames'. To use the plugin, either:

  1. Select frames, and run the plugin.
  2. If nothing is selected, the plugin will run for all frames in the current page.

plugins.name: Randomise colour
plugins.description:
Randomise colour - Premium color randomization straight outta Europe, for your viewing pleasure!


Applies colour variations to selected objects (Everything with solid fill, stroke or gradients works, including text). Great for creating an organic, handmade look, or wild patterns.


Applies variations using normal distribution, with original colour as mean, and distance setting as sigma, sometimes resulting in extreme outliers. Selected object's original colours are cached as long as the plugin is open.


Options:

  • Hue distance from original colour
  • Saturation distance from original colour
  • Lightness distance from original colour
  • Opacity distance from original colour
  • Include fills
  • Include strokes
  • Include gradients

plugins.name: Icon Scaling Tool
plugins.description:
Creating multiple sizes of icons is easy with the Microsoft Design Icon Scaling tool


With this plugin you can:


- Draw once and scale to multiple sizes with a single click

- Apply the Fluent Design System weight to icons, at the right sizes

- Check for naming, duplicates, and sizing errors with your icon sets before you export

- Correct errors on your Figma canvas and regenerate icon sizes with updates

- Inspect your icon in the tool to ensure it lands on the grid

- Ensure icons pass the even-odd fill rule and have non-zero winding with a built-in tool to correct

- Prepare your set for export as a .zip file that contains SVGs, PDFs, and a text description


Notes:


- We recommend that you start your icon design size at 24px for best results

- Icon layer names should follow the naming convention of Name / Size / Theme. For example, 'Folder / 24 / Regular'

- Using 'Thin' weight will apply a 1 px stroke to all icon sizes. 'Regular' weight will adhere to Fluent Design System rules for icons


Usage:


The Icon Scaling tool uses Fill Rule Editor for even odd error inspection under MIT license.


Thanks:


This tool was created by the Meta-Design Studio for Microsoft Design. Thanks to Prasanna Gunuru, Spencer Nelson, Jason Custer, Damien Aistrope and Zann St Pierre.

plugins.name: Dashicons Icon Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
Dashicons Icon Set is a unique icon library, in that it's designed and maintained by WordPress. It's been open sourced for years, and includes 342 beautiful (but simple) icons that you can use in your Figma files.


It's been open sourced under the MIT license.


Popular Dashicons icons:

  • Checkmarks & arrows
  • Badges & warning icons
  • Logos and brands


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Dashicons icon
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history

plugins.name: BG Remover & Image Enhancer by Picsart
plugins.description:
Better than Native: Supercharge Your Figma Workflow with Background Removal & Boost Resolution ‚Äì Try 40 Images Free


Transform your design process with the Picsart Plugin for Figma‚Äîa powerful alternative to Figma‚Äôs native Remove Background and Boost Resolution tools. Designed for UI/UX designers, marketers, product teams, and creatives, this plugin lets you enhance images with precision and ease‚Äîand process up to 40 images for free when you sign up.


Key Features

1. AI-Powered Background Removal

Effortlessly remove unwanted backgrounds to create professional, clean visuals in seconds. Perfect for isolating product images, custom icons, or design elements.


2. Ultra-Resolution Image Upscaling

Upscale images up to 8x while preserving quality. Ensure your visuals look sharp and professional across all screen sizes and resolutions.


3. Effortless Integration

No need to switch between tools. Work seamlessly within Figma and let the plugin handle tedious edits, so you can focus on your creative vision.


4. Broad File Compatibility

Supports JPG, PNG, TIFF, WEBP, and MPO formats for maximum flexibility in your design projects.


Why Choose the Picsart Plugin?

  1. Save Time: Automate repetitive tasks and accelerate your design process.
  2. Boost Productivity: Streamline workflows with features that simplify image editing.
  3. Enhance Creativity: Unlock new creative possibilities with advanced tools at your fingertips.


Popular Use Cases

  1. E-commerce Product Design: Remove backgrounds and upscale product images for clean, professional listings that shine on any device.
  2. Social Media Graphics: Create polished, engaging visuals for posts, stories, and ads with high-resolution images.
  3. Marketing Collateral: Design stunning banners, flyers, and brochures with customized, crisp visuals.
  4. Custom UI/UX Elements: Generate high-quality icons, buttons, and components that stay sharp across screen sizes.


How to Set Up the Plugin

  1. Sign Up for an API Key: Visit Picsart and register for free to get your API key. You‚Äôll be able to remove backgrounds or upscale up to 40 images for free‚Äîno payment required.
  2. Activate the Plugin: Open Figma, navigate to the Plugins menu, and activate the Picsart Plugin. Input your API key to start using the tools immediately.
  3. Recharge When Needed: When your free credits run out, easily top up by purchasing more at our pricing page.


Get Started Today

Say goodbye to complex workflows and hello to seamless design efficiency. Download the Picsart Plugin for Figma and elevate your designs with AI-powered background removal and ultra-resolution upscaling.


Learn More & Get Started

plugins.name: Align To
plugins.description:
Want to align layers to a specific layer, and have that layer stay fixed while the other layers move? You got it!

How it works:
1. Select the layers you'd like to align
2. Launch the Plugin
3. You can select the layers when the plugin is already active, just click on "Get Selection" button.
4. Select the layer you'd like to stay fixed.
5. Click on the Alignment buttons.

Enjoy.

plugins.name: Shape Builder Tool
plugins.description:
Shape Builder Tool can help you quickly complete the shape creation work. Shape creation mainly supports two modes, ADD mode (+ icon) and SUB mode (- icon)


The Replace Selection button will use the shape created by the Shape Builder Tool to replace the selected shape at the original position.

The Copy To Canvas button will place the created image next to the original selected shape.


You can use cmd+z (MacOS) / ctrl + z (Win) to undo operations, and use cmd + shift + z (MacOS) / ctrl + shift + z (Win) to redo operations.
plugins.tagline: A shape builder tool that enhances your Boolean operations for creating shapes in Figma.

plugins.name: Image Compressor
plugins.description:
Batch-compress images in Figma.


If your canvas has many frames with high-definition images, Figma can lag or run out of memory. By compressing your images, you can save on memory and make your files run more smoothly.


This plugin will compress and replace your image fills automatically.


To use this plugin:

  • Select one or more objects on your Figma canvas
  • Hit the ‚Äòscan‚Äô button to start scanning for image fills
  • Once the scan completes, select the images you want to compress
  • Adjust your scan settings (optional)
  • Hit the ‚Äòcompress‚Äô button to compress the selected images
  • The plugin will compress and replace the image fills selected


Notes:

  • Running this on very large files can be slow
  • It's suggested to batch a large file into smaller runs of the plugin, e.g. up to 300 images at a time, for best results


Questions?

  • Reach out to @guamhat on Twitter
  • The plugin code is open sourced here

accepted.name: Gautham üå∂
accepted.description: hi

plugins.tagline: Reduce Figma memory usage by compressing your images

Here‚Äôs why FigMeme is awesome:

  • Search using a keyword: Can‚Äôt find the perfect meme yet? Explore the meme-verse using a keyword.

  • Save your favourites: Easily access your go-to memes by ‚Äòadding to favourite‚Äô.

plugins.name: Origami Pasteboard
plugins.description:
Copy layers from Figma to Origami Studio to create highly customizable and dynamic prototypes.


To use, open this plugin and select the frames or layers you would like to transfer. Then click "Copy selected layers". After the operation completes, simply paste the selected layers from your clipboard.


While Origami supports many properties from Figma, some layers may be automatically modified when pasting in order to appear correctly.


If certain areas of the prototype do not transfer correctly or do not need to be modified, copy selected layers as a single flattened PNG (‚áß‚åòC) or use Figma‚Äôs native export as necessary.


For questions and support, please visit the Origami Community Group on Facebook.
plugins.tagline: Copy layers from Figma to Origami Studio

plugins.name: Instant Website Beta
plugins.description:
A plugin for turning your Figma designs into real websites you can share, no login required!


If you want to take your website to the next level, with custom domains and more, a login to Instant Website is required.


The plugin itself and it's basic functionality is free for everyone to use. We automatically add a banner in the bottom of your website which can be removed by subscribing to the Pro Plan on https://dashboard.instantwebsite.app

plugins.name: Label Maker
plugins.description:
Create labels permanently linked with your layers' names. Push updates from either direction, and never again copy and paste names manually to identify things on your canvas.



How to use

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

‚íà Select one or multiple layers

‚íâ Go to the plugin menu and select Label Maker ‚ñ∏ From Layer Name


That's it! One label for each selected layer is now created. The menu commands are used for both creating and updating labels, and layers can only have one label in the document at a time.



What you can do

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì

‚Ä¢ Push and pull the latest names using sidebar shortcuts or the Figma menu

‚Ä¢ Find the layer linked to the current selection, even across different pages

‚Ä¢ Click on any label and restore its master component to edit label styles across your file

‚Ä¢ Leverage Figma's quick switch between text objects to rename several labels in a row, then propagate all changes to the layers' names



FAQ

‚Äî‚Äî

‚Ä¢ I don't see sidebar shortcuts on my layer!

That could be either because you didn't run the plugin from the menu on that layer at least once, or because you're using an instance of a component. Figma doesn't support registering sidebar shortcuts in instances yet, but the plugin still works from the menu.


‚Ä¢ Can I run it via a keyboard shortcut?

For many workflows, relying on Figma's native ‚åòÔºã‚å•ÔºãP (Run Last Plugin) should speed things up enough. The plugin's commands don't distinguish between creation and update exactly so that the only shortcut we have is as smart as it can be. If you still want to register them permanently on your Mac, you can create custom shortcuts in macOS: https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/mac-help/mchlp2271/mac

accepted.name: Henrique Gusso
accepted.description: Design Tooling at Wise

plugins.tagline: Create labels permanently linked with your layers' names
